intro: Koanophyllon obtusissimum, commonly known as the bluntleaf bluegrass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves with a bluish-green hue and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought tolerance through its deep root system and reduced leaf surface area. Koanophyllon obtusissimum plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for small desert organisms.
